author: seamonkey82
content: If anyone currently has prysm-besu or prysm-erigon synced on kiln using the latest commits, can you please share your settings?  Two days ago, an update broke things for those two pairs as well as prysm-ethereumjs.  The only way I could get ethereumjs back online was to run eth and engine on the same port *and* disable `rpcEngineAuth`.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: the shadow forks are just "dry run" forks that only trigger on the clients configured manually to follow the shadow fork, so that the tests can be repeated multiple times w/o actually forking a real testnet (and "wasting" it if there's a bug that makes the fork fail).  Once everyone is happy w/ the shadow forks I presume the next step will be to fork goerli, sepolia, and ropsten (not sure if in that order) and then mainnet.
